18.title: Directing on a Micro Budget
18.plot: Filmmakers Matt Brooks, Bill Alexander, Robert Kotabish and Bruno Tatalovic talk about how to successfully direct films on a micro budget.

1.title: Guerrilla Filmmaking, Part 2
1.plot: In this episode of Indie Film School, filmmakers Ernie Smith, Robert Banks and Bruno Tatalovic talk about guerrilla filmmaking.

2.title: Stunts for Film
2.plot: Stuntman Rick Shaw talks about safely incorporating stunts into your film.

3.title: Accessorizing Your DSLR Camera on a Budget
3.plot: Johnny Wu talks about accessorizing your DSLR camera on a budget, how to compare brands/prices, and the pros and cons of some popular camera accessories.

4.title: Tips for Professional Actors
4.plot: Actors Joe Estevez, Constance Estevez, Kristina Michelle, Saba and Patrick Hampton talk about their careers and give acting tips to the audience.

5.title: Editing Discussion
5.plot: Filmmakers Cal Nguyen, Peter John Ross and Patrick Hampton talk about editing.

6.title: The Director's Discussion
6.plot: Filmmakers Saba, Gary Jones, Harper Philbin and Peter John Ross talking about directing.

7.title: Legal Aspects of Filmmaking 3
7.plot: Entertainment Attorney Mary Ellen Tomazic talks about legal aspects of filmmaking.

8.title: Audio Recording
8.plot: In this episode of Indie Film School, filmmaker Johnny Wu will tell you about different audio devices and how to get better sound.

9.title: Cinematography
9.plot: Filmmakers Bruno Tatalovic, Ryan Atkins and Christian Taylor talk about cinematography and how to make your low-budget film look higher quality.

10.title: Locations
10.plot: Producer Ray Szuch talks about how to secure your locations on a budget and the opportunities the North Coast Film Commission brings filmmakers.

11.title: Screenwriting Discussion
11.plot: Screenwriters Carson Parish, Saba, Patrick Hampton, Joe Randazzo and Mara Lesemann talk about their writing process and what makes a script successful.

12.title: Marketing
12.plot: Johnny Wu of MDI Films talks about successfully marketing your film.

13.title: Directing IIII
13.plot: This episode of Indie Film School features a discussion on directing with Gary Jones, Keith Collins and William Alexander.

14.title: Acting Discussion
14.plot: Actors Mark Torgl, Kristina Michelle and Mike Trivisonno talk about acting during a panel at The International Horror Hotel.

16.title: Screenwriting Discussion

17.title: Legal Discussion
17.plot: Features a lecture on legal aspects of filmmaking with Mary Ellen Tomazic from The 2014 International Horror Hotel.

18.title: Producing Lecture

19.title: Accessorizing Your DSLR

imdb.plot outline: Have you wanted to go to film school but can't find the time and money? Be a part of "Indie Film School", an ongoing series that will teach you about all the aspects of independent filmmaking! Shown by experts in each field, you will get the equivalent of a full on-set experience, learning proper lighting, sound, stunts, FX makeup, set designing, cinematography, and more. Learn the pros and cons of all the newest film equipment directly from the people that are using them. With behind the scenes exclusives, in-the-field training, and step-by-step instructions, "Indie Film School" is the place for you.
imdb.title: Indie Film School

Shown by experts in each field, you will get the equivalent of a full on-set experience, learning proper lighting, sound, stunts, FX makeup, set designing, cinematography, and more. Learn the pros and cons of all the newest film equipment directly from the people that are using them. With behind the scenes exclusives, in-the-field training, and step-by-step instructions, "_Indie Film School_ (qv)" is the place for you.::_Indie Film School_ (qv)
